symptoms.name: Reddish patches and plaques
symptoms.pattern: Progressive enlargement and spread to trunk and limbs

symptoms.name: Hypochromic macules
symptoms.pattern: Can become red, edematous, and enlarged after MDT initiation

symptoms.name: Headache
symptoms.pattern: Occurred in one case after MDT initiation

symptoms.name: Nausea
symptoms.pattern: Occurred in one case after MDT initiation

symptoms.name: Pain
symptoms.pattern: Accompanied edema in one case during type 1 reaction

physical_findings: Multiple infiltrated reddish patches and plaques
Tender and thickened peripheral nerves (ulnar nerves in one case)
risk_factors: Close contact with untreated leprosy cases

imaging_findings.ultrasonography: Reduction of blood flow around ulnar nerves in one case

required: At least one of the following: definite loss of sensation in a pale (hypopigmented) or reddish skin patch; thickened or enlarged peripheral nerve, with loss of sensation and/or weakness of the muscles supplied by that nerve; microscopic detection of bacilli in a slit-skin smear
supportive: Histopathological findings (plasmocytic and lymphocytic infiltration in the nerve tract)
